explanation: Correct. internal_run_from_select declares the fd_set parameters as const fd_set * but repeatedly casts them to fd_set * via the _MHD_DROP_CONST macro and passes that non-const pointer into FD_ISSET. That removes the const qualification of objects that are (and should remain) const and therefore defeats the intent of declaring the parameters const. This contravenes MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 (pointers should point to const-qualified types whenever possible). The cast-away-const is the direct cause (see e.g. need_to_accept = FD_ISSET(ds, (fd_set *) _MHD_DROP_CONST(read_fd_set)); and similar uses for write_fd_set/except_fd_set). Recommended remedies are exactly as A suggested: avoid dropping const (use an FD_ISSET variant accepting const if available), make a local non-const copy of the fd_set and call FD_ISSET on that, or otherwise revise the API so constness is preserved.
